paragraphs.name: d1cc
paragraphs.text: There are big stories and stories that deserve to be big stories. The latter is particularly compelling since Medium is becoming such a good home to content on the web that would otherwise not be shared. If Blogger was step one in this journey, and Twitter was step two, Medium is the logical continuation. The team has managed to create a home on the web so inviting that not only do people want to post their thoughts on Medium, people find their voice here.

881e3cd0018b.title: I once described Medium to a colleague as the offspring of WordPress and Twitter.

paragraphs.text: I once described Medium to a colleague as the offspring of WordPress and Twitter. But it is and it isn’t.
paragraphs.name: c258

paragraphs.text: It has the things that we love(d) about WordPress and few of the ones we don’t (especially the stuff that makes WordPress feel too much like, well, Word).

ae82982fa957.title: So, do those plans include providing some kind of financial remuneration for writers who drive…

paragraphs.text: So, do those plans include providing some kind of financial remuneration for writers who drive traffic to Medium? Because a lot of us are still creating quality work and attracting serious traffic, but for free. It would be nice if we could, you know, get PAID for the content we’re producing.
paragraphs.name: 6bbd

fa70bad727ae.title: This is what keeps me coming back to Medium.

paragraphs.text: This is what keeps me coming back to Medium. The ability to follow writers and topics — big and small — has made for an incredibly rich reading and discovery experience. It reminds me of Twitter’s summary emails, and “what happened while you were gone.” Difference being that Medium has the content in a consistently beautiful and usable form, not just…
paragraphs.name: 3d6d

3d8c8e9425ec.title: I did a similar experiment when I was first trying out Medium.

paragraphs.text: I did a similar experiment when I was first trying out Medium. I posted a story without sharing it anywhere else and was shocked when I got hundreds of readers who actually engaged either through recommends or leaving notes. I honestly thought I would get zero, so hundreds was a big deal to me. My intent was to practice writing and not garner an…
paragraphs.name: ba9a

paragraphs.text: Congratulations! Very exciting times.
paragraphs.name: cb07

8bfbf1623af7.title: When folks talk about the next great social network, I immediately think of Medium.

paragraphs.text: When folks talk about the next great social network, I immediately think of Medium. Medium has all the elements of the household names: a core of people who love it, it grows organically, and serious people can build business projects on top of it. Seems like a smart bet.

373997a76bca.title: Please do not add a personalization feature.

paragraphs.text: Please do not add a personalization feature. I like to read and discover new content that doesn’t necessarily come from my preference or previous reading history. If it’s a good read, it’s a good read, regardless of whether it’s about Picasso’s paintings or an essay on the works of Alkhwarizmi.
paragraphs.name: 829c

paragraphs.text: Where I’d love to see Medium headed
paragraphs.name: 1d55

paragraphs.text: I’m super excited to see where Medium is headed with its objective to be the publishing platform for everyone. And so I thought I’d take this opportunity to also share a few of my thoughts on what I like best about Medium and where I’d like to see it headed.

paragraphs.text: I recently discovered Medium, and I like the format, user interface, and the general quality of writing here for the most part. I don’t like Twitter and I’m taking a break from Facebook, so this is a nice site to spend some time on when I’m not blogging on my own platform.
